The Theory of general relativity predicts that a sufficiently compact mass can deform space time to form a black hole. The boundary of the region from which no escape is possible is called the event horizon. Although crossing the event horizon has enormous effect on the fate of the object crossing it, it appears to have no locally detectable features. In many ways a black hole acts like an ideal black body, as it reflects no light. The main theory for the existence of a black hole is based on Newton’s law of gravity that objects attract objects…. Newton's law of universal gravitation states that every particle attracts every other particle in the universe with a force which is directly proportional to the product of their masses and inversely proportional to the square of the distance between their centers. So based on Newton’s gravity a black hole has to be an object with a very large mass, millions or billions times bigger than our sun. The main problems for the explaining black holes are 1 We can't see them 2 They occupy a small space retaliative to their mass 3 Dust, gas and stars can orbit very close without being destroyed 4 There are small black holes and super massive black holes, but no medium sized black holes So our standard explanation is that gravity is so powerful that it collapses the mass into a tiny object, trapping light and anything else that gets pulled into its event horizon. Black hole theory number two starts back with rewriting Newton’s law of gravity. Let's say that Newton was wrong and that particles don’t attract other particles. We can suggest a new law of gravity Liquid Gravity's law of universal gravitation states -that every particle continuously produces negative pressure within the universal medium. -that the primary negative pressure accumulates around objects. -that excess negative pressure accumulates at the center of object clusters to form gravitational wells. -that a gravitational well will attract objects together, -that gravitational force on an object is produced by the pressure differential between the opposite sides of the object which pushes an object in the direction of a gravitational well. -that gravitational pressure is reduced by the square of its distance from the center of the gravitational well. -that gravitational wells exist within bigger gravitational wells -that the density of gravitational wells control the speed of light, time and distance. -that gravity strength increases over time due to the gradual accumulation of negative pressure within a gravitational well. So with our new theory of gravity we can redefine our black hole and how it works. The first thing is that gravity is the result of accumulated negative pressure rather than force between two objects, which simply means we don’t need a super massive object, we just need a big galaxy that is producing a lot of excess gravity. The process between the two stages is a slow accumulation of negative pressure, where dust and gas accumulates to form form stars and grow into solar systems, then solar clusters. The increasing pressure pulls solar clusters together, but also increases their rotation speed around the center, This increase of rotation prevents galaxies just collapsing into the center and maintains large stars in orbit around an empty center point. The super massive Black hole is the vortex at the center of a galaxy that has formed at the point where the accumulated pressure and spinning action produces a vortex funnel that spins the high negative pressure back out into space. The vortex are the jets that are visible when matter or gas get caught up into the vortex funnel and become illuminated as they are ejected back out into the edge of the galaxy. The power of the super massive black hole is not produced by the black hole eating stars ad collapsing matter, but as a result all the force from every object within the galaxy pushing into the center.
